basics.name: Brayden Noh
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher
basics.summary: Caltech senior studying Earth science and computational modeling, with experience in probabilistic hazard modeling, geomorphology, and planetary science.

work.name: Caltech Lamb Surface Processing Group
work.summary: Developed risk maps for river migration using Monte Carlo simulations and Bayesian inference from satellite data.
highlights: Transformed deterministic models into probabilistic forecasts.
Improved erosion hazard through uncertainty quantification.

work.name: Georgia Tech TECHtonic Research Group
work.summary: Enhanced photogrammetry tools and built probabilistic sediment transport models for Puerto Rican rivers.
highlights: Converted MATLAB photogrammetry algorithms to Python.
Generated 3D riverbed models for sediment transport modeling.

work.name: Auburn University Mechanics of Materials Laboratory
work.summary: Simulated meteoroid impacts with the SALE hydrocode.
highlights: Modeled atmospheric entry and crater formation using Fortran.
Characterized asteroid shape to investigate its influence on resulting impact crater morphology.
